comment: The "distinctor" expression ` -. A. x x = y ` , stating that ` x ` and ` y ` are not the same variable, can be written in terms of ` F/ ` in the obvious way. This theorem is not true in a one-element domain, because then ` F/_ x y ` and ` A. x x = y ` will both be true. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 8-Oct-2016.)
